page.title: 09The sand dunes (1)
page.content:
The sand dunes are known as{Les {Blanches Banques}and are an area that has been kept largely free of development so that people can use them for personal recreation. Apart from the golf course, the dunes were entirely open unto the early 1950s when the estates in the SW corner of the block were begun. Subsequently one further estate was allowed, against opposition, on the north side along Mont a la Brune hill.
{Car access}onto the dunes was unrestricted until the 1970s when, after an attempt at voluntary restraint to stop the damaging erosion, the whole area was sealed off to cars and a series of landscaped car parks provided around the periphery.
